name: Main Beach
directions: FROM NORTH: Take the 405 or 5 to the 133 Freeway towards Laguna Beach;  Go 9 miles to the water and you dead-end into Main Beach; Tournament check in is at the south end of Main Beach;  Parking is meters or lots (usually $10 all day) and you can park in the neighborhoods above Cliff Drive or off Park Avenue for free and walk to the site. FROM THE SOUTH: If you're coming from San Diego up through San Clemente, exit at Beach Cities Exit (just north of San Clemente) and go north on Coast Highway through Dana Point and into Laguna;  Travel 11 miles into downtown Laguna and park as noted above; If you're coming coming North from San Juan Capistrano or Mission Viejo, you can also take the 405 to the 133 and go West 9 miles to the water.

name: East Beach
directions:
FROM NORTH - Cabrillo Blvd off-ramp, take a right on Cabrillo (head toward ocean); East Beach is approx 1/4 mile, Parking is after the courts.

FROM SOUTH - Cabrillo Blvd off -ramp, take a left on Cabrillo Blvd (head toward ocean); East Beach is approx 1/2 mile Parking just past courts on left

name: Waterfront Park
directions: Monterey Bay Waterfront Park runs alongside Monterey State Beach, just east of Wharf #2, and holds a number of recreational opportunities, including sand volleyball courts. There's free parking along Del Monte Avenue, as well as several paid municipal lots within close walking distance. (https://www.seemonterey.com/things-to-do/beaches/monterey/)

name: Beach Blvd
directions: From the 405 Freeway, take the "Beach Blvd South" exit and proceed to the ocean.  Cross PCH and turn right into the City parking lot. The courts are in front of Zach's Too. Plenty of pay parking ($15) is available right next to the courts or if you have a state pass, park on the south parking lot at Beach Blvd (state side).  Free parking is available on Beach Blvd. if you arrive early enough.
description: Check-in: 8 - 8:40 a.m. Pool Play starts promptly at 9 a.m. Concession stand at Beach Blvd.

name: Will Rogers
directions:
FROM NORTH – From PCH pass Sunset Blvd; Travel approximately 1 mile; Courts are just south of Temescal Canyon Road at Entrada directly across from Patrick's Roadhouse & the Chevron gas station lifeguard tower #18.
FROM SOUTH – From Hwy 10 to PCH; Travel ¼ mile past Wilshire at Entrada directly across from Patrick's Roadhouse & the Chevron station; Courts are visible on the left at lifeguard tower #18.

name: Pismo Beach
directions: FROM SOUTH- 101 freeway (north) to Wadsworth Avenue in Pismo Beach; Turn left under freeway; Go two blocks; Courts on the end of Wadsworth Avenue. FROM NORTH- 101 freeway (south) exit at “Pismo Beach Highway 1”; Proceed straight on Dolliver; Second Street on right is Wadsworth Avenue, Turn right; Courts are at the end of Wadsworth Avenue; Parking is free.

name: Mira Costa College
directions: Directions: Take Hyw 78 to College Blvd. North on College Blvd. Left on Barard Drive. Go up the hill past the tennis courts. Take a right on the next street. Courts are next to the gymnasium. Parking lot next to the gym.
description:
DEADLINE TO ENTRY & REFUNDS: Deadline is 5:00 pm the day before a tournament. No refunds after 12:00 pm on the day before the tournament. NO EXCEPTIONS.

ON THE DAY OF THE TOURNAMENT: Check in is at 8:15 am. At 9:00 we will review tournament rules and demonstrate some of the basic beach volleyball skills need to compete in the tournament. At 9:15 we will assign pools and courts. Competition begins at 9:30. Playoffs normally start at 1:00 and the tournament ends around 4:30. Wave VB Courts check in will 8:30, competition begins at 9:00.

WHAT TO BRING TO THE TOURNAMENT: Plenty of water, sun protection and lunch.

name: North Beach
directions:
These courts are about 1/2 mile north of the Santa Monica Pier.
1200 Palisades Beach Rd, Santa Monica, CA 90401
Park Lot #3 "Perry's Cafe 1200
First parking lot North on Hwy 1 as you transition from the 10 fwy West through the McClure Tunnel
description: Perry's Cafe 1200 Location includes restrooms, food, bike rentals, umbrellas, showers. Parking for 350 cars. Cafe opens at 9:30am. Extensive menu for food and drinks.

name: Downtown
directions:
Downtown Location - Marina Green Park/Los Alamitos Beach: located *At corner of Ocean and Shoreline Dr in Downtown Long Beach, CA
From 405 Freeway, take 710 Freeway South; Take Shoreline Dr & follow convention center signs; AFTER Linden St., turn right to park.

name: Marine Ave
directions:
From the 405: Exit Rosecrans Ave W & drive 2 3/4 miles (approximately 6 minutes) Turn left at Highland Avenue & drive 1/2 miles (approximately 2 minutes)
Parking Information and Volleyball Courts
* For Metered Parking: Turn right at 26th Street & drive 1 1/2 blocks.
* There is also free street parking in the area.
* Volleyball Courts are one block north of Marine Street between 23rd Street and 25th Street.
description:
CBVA Marine

Tournaments are at Marine in Manhattan Beach. Marine and specifically Orange Court, is a legendary location for beach volleyball with a long proud history.

All of these tournaments have a check in by 8:30 and start at 9am.

Directions:
From the 405: Exit Rosecrans Ave W & drive 2 3/4 miles (approximately 6 minutes) Turn left at Highland Avenue & drive 1/2 miles (approximately 2 minutes)

Parking Information and Volleyball Courts
* For Metered Parking: Turn right at 26th Street & drive 1 1/2 blocks.
* There is also free street parking in the area.
* Volleyball Courts are one block north of Marine between 23rd Street and 25th Street.

CBVA Marine Director
Kevin Norman
(310) 345-7341

name: Will Rogers North
directions:
Directions to Pacific Palisades Beach 15100 PCH. Coming from the 405 south take the 10 west continue on to PCH North 3 miles turn left on Temescal Canyon Rd into the Temescal Canyon parking lot and drive to the south end of lot. Coming from the North we are 1 ½ miles south of Sunset Blvd on PCH, again enter Temescal Canyon parking lot and drive to the south end of the lot.
Please drive slowly through parking lot!
description: 15100 PCH  - Temescal Canyon Rd entrance (southern most part of parking lot)

name: South Mission Beach
directions: Take 5 Fwy. south to Seaworld Dr. Turn right on West Mission Bay Dr. Turn left on Mission Blvd and follow to end - turn right into parking lot.

name: Bolsa Chica, Huntington Beach
directions:
Copy and paste this MapURL in your browser:
https://www.google.com/maps/dir/33.6862611,-118.0386493/33.6859086,-118.0388429/@33.6873238,-118.046052,15z/data=!4m2!4m1!3e0

Enter at the Bolsa Chica State Beach entrance from Pacific Coast Highway. After passing the parking gate, head left (south) about 1/2 mile to Pacific Kitchen. These are the only courts on the entire beach.
description: Check-in: 8 - 8:40 a.m. Pool Play starts promptly at 9 a.m.

name: Santa Monica Pier
description: The Santa Monica Pier is on the South side of the Pier at the newly renovated courts. There is plenty of parking and close-by restrooms. Come enjoy a tournament where everything you could imagine is within walking distance.

name: Playa del Rey
directions: FROM NORTH OR SOUTH - 405 Fwy to 90 Fwy (Marina Fwy) West; Freeway ends at Culver Blvd, turn left (at signal); Courts are at the end of Culver; Ample free street parking.

name: Rosecrans
directions:
Take 405 Fwy to Rosecrans, West; From freeway take Rosecrans to Highland make a right; Left on 45th street down to one way parking lot.
Street parking off of Bell Street and Rosecrans east of Highland Ave Parking lot is meter parking ($0.25 every 20 minutes); Parking in the El Porto parking lot.

name: Manhattan Pier
directions:
FROM 405 SOUTH - Freeway 405 to Inglewood Avenue exit; Turn left at light on to Inglewood Avenue to Manhattan Beach Boulevard; Turn right on Manhattan Beach Boulevard to the Manhattan Beach Pier.
FROM 405 NORTH-Freeway 405 to Inglewood Avenue exit; Turn right on Inglewood Avenue to Manhattan Beach Boulevard; Right on Manhattan Beach Boulevard to Manhattan Beach Pier; Meter Parking is $1 per hour.
description: Home of the Charlie Saikley Six Man, Jr. Sixman, CBVA and the Manhattan Beach Open.

name: Doheny State Beach
directions:
FROM SOUTH – Take Interstate 5 North to Beach Cities/Camino Las Ramblas off ramp; Pass through tunnel to reach Pacific Coast Hwy; Travel 1 mile; Turn left at Dana Point Harbor Drive; Turn left at the first traffic light which is Doheny State Beach.

FROM NORTH – Take Interstate 5 South to the Pacific Coast Hwy/Camino Las Ramblas off ramp; Stay right to reach Pacific Coast Hwy; Travel 1 mile; Turn left on Dana Point Harbor Drive; Turn left at the first traffic light which is Doheny State Beach

name: Newport Beach
directions:
Directions will be included in your confirmation email. If your partner registered your team, ask them to forward the confirmation email for all the specifics. Online registration is required to play in Newport Tournaments.
Thanks

name: Zuma Beach
directions:
From Santa Monica and the Westside take Pacific Coast Hwy north approximately 22 miles to the Zuma Beach access road and enter the parking lot.
From the 101 Fwy heading North of the 405 or South from Ventura, exit at Kanan Dume and head west towards the ocean; Turn right at Pacific Coast Hwy and head north to the Zuma Beach access road to enter the parking lot.
Note: There is free street parking on the southbound traffic side of PCH.
description: Bathrooms, Showers, Food Concession and plenty of parking.

name: Ocean Park
directions:
SANTA MONICA / OCEAN PARK COURTS
2400 Ocean Front Walk
Santa Monica, CA 90405.

PARKING: 2030 Ocean Ave, LOT 4 SOUTH.
Santa Monica, CA 90405
ENTER AT HOLLISTER AVE.
description:
Ocean Park has 16 courts just south of the Santa Monica Pier & is within walking distance to restaurants, bars & coffee shops on historic Main St.
All day 'long term' lot parking $8 - $10 - credit cards accepted.
2hr 'short term' lot parking - credit card accepted.

name: Central Beach
directions:
Directions:  900 Ocean Blvd, Coronado, Ca 92118
Take I-5 South past Downtown San Diego to the Coronado Bay Exit.

Take the Coronado Bay Exit to Orange Ave.
Left on Orange Ave to RH Dana Place (in front of the Hotel del Coronado).
Right on RH Dana Place to Ocean Blvd.
Courts are located next to the lifeguard tower.
description:
Aloha

Come and play at Central Beach, Coronado. Rated one of the top
10 beaches in the U.S. by Travel Advisor Magazine and Dr. Beach.

Parking is free all day.

Just a 5 minute walk to the local eateries. Parking is free. Stick around after the tournament is see one of the most beautiful sunsets in Southern California. Sun rise is not bad either.

What to bring: Sunscreen, beach towel, beach chair, lunch and plenty of water.

See you at the Beach.

name: Hermosa Pier
directions: 405 freeway from either direction to Artesia Blvd West; Go to Aviation Blvd turn left; Go to PCH turn right; Go to Pier Ave turn left which will lead directly to the Pier. Courts are on the North side, and Parking(which is free) is available a few blocks East on Valley Drive 5 Blocks East of the Pier or 1 block West of PCH on Valley just South of Pier Ave.
description:
The Hermosa Pier is arguably the best place in the world to play beach volleyball. Hermosa's beautiful beach and deep, soft sand are ideal for the game.

The tournament site is bordered by restaurants, bars, shops and hotels.  These factors always ensure the strongest, deepest competition on the court and a festive, party-like atmosphere on the sidelines. We also offer a wide array of beach volleyball lessons, camps, classes and private parties through our website at www.campsurf.com. Just click on the "volleyball" tab and you will get detailed information. Hope to see you at the beach!

name: Huntington Pier
directions: From the 405 Freeway, take the "Beach Blvd South" exit and proceed to the ocean;  Turn right on PCH and proceed one mile to the pier;  Tournament courts are on both sides of the pier, and plenty of pay parking is available right next to the courts;  The nearest free parking is 3 blocks north of the pier, back in the neighborhood.
description:
Check-in: 8 - 8:40 a.m.
Pool Play starts promptly at 9 a.m.
Parking: $15/day on the weekends in the nearby lots or can park for FREE in the adjacent neighborhood if you arrive early enough. Lots of nearby restaurants and shops; Surf City Days events going on throughout the beach area and Main St.

name: Belmont Shore
directions:
From the North - Take the 405 South to the 710 South. Stay left for Downtown Long Beach toward convention center/aquarium. Merge onto W Shoreline Dr. Turn Right on Ocean Blvd. Stay right on Ocean Blvd. Make your first right past Termino into the parking lot. Courts are southeast of the pool. Metered parking in the lot or free parking on the street.

From the South - Take the 405 North to the 22 W/7th Street; Turn Left at Ximeno; Right on East Livingston; 1st Left on Termino; Left on Ocean; Make your first right into the parking lot; Courts are southeast of the pool; Metered parking in the lot or free parking on the street.
description:
Welcome to CBVA in Long Beach!!

Time: Check-in 8:30-8:45AM; competition begins at 9:00AM.

Food: There are many great restaurants and bars within a couple of blocks. Alfredo's Beach Shack is on the beach and there are a variety of restaurants within a short drive on 2nd Street.

Be sure to bring your beach chair, umbrella, plenty of water, sandsocks & sunscreen. AND YOUR DOG (this is one of very few beach spots that is actually a DOG BEACH)

Summer camps and year round training with Sinjin: www.beachvolleyballcamps.com

name: Mission Beach
directions: Take 5 Fwy South to Seaworld Dr; Turn right on West Mission Bay Dr; Turn left on Mission Blvd and follow to end - turn right into parking lot.
description:
Welcome to another exciting season of beach volleyball in America's Finest City - San Diego, CA. We hope that your experience playing CBVA Beach Volleyball will be an enjoyable one.

Tournament site: South Mission Beach Volleyball Courts - 2677 Ocean Front Walk, San Diego, CA 92109

Tournament deadline: Deadline is 5:00 pm the day before a tournament. No refunds after 12:00 on the day before a tournament. NO EXCEPTIONS.

What to bring to the tournament: Plenty of water, sun protection, and lunch. A beach towel, chair, and umbrella/shade is a good idea. Local eateries are about a 5 minute walk from the courts.

On the day of the tournament: Check in is at 8:15 am. Competition begins at 9:00am. We will have pool play and then single elimination playoffs.

name: Newland
directions:
We're 2 miles south of the Huntington Beach Pier, in front of the SMOKE STACKS at Newland Street in the State Park. Cars are advised to enter the park on Pacific Coast Highway at the Beach Blvd. or Magnolia entrances. The parking fee is $15-$20/day but you can leave and re-enter, which is great for food-runs. You can also buy the $195 annual pass which works at all the state beaches and parks. Parking is near the courts; restrooms are close by too, and sometimes there is a food truck.
SPEED LIMIT IN THE PARK: 15MPH.
DON'T SPEED IN THE PARK. KIDS ARE EVERYWHERE, AND SO ARE RANGERS WHO HAVE THE POWER TO CANCEL OUR TOURNAMENTS.
description:
Check-in no later than 8:30 a.m. Play starts promptly at 9 a.m. On arrival, please go to the tournament tent to verify the court number you will be playing on. For questions/information or late entry possibilities, please text Therese at 714-724-2453.

If you want to order Acai bowls, please text Leila (818) 963-2321 no later than 8:30 the morning of the tournament. She will deliver to our tent around 11:30.

* CLASSIC BOWL: ACAI + GRANOLA + BANANA $10
* BERRY BOWL: ACAI + GRANOLA + BANANA + BLUEBERRIES + STRAWBERRIES $12
* SUPER BOWL: ACAI + GRANOLA + BANANA + CACAO + COCONUT + HEMP SEEDS $12
* EXTRA ADD ONS: HONEY, ALMOND BUTTER, PEANUT BUTTER, GLUTEN FREE GRANOLA $1

name: Ocean Beach
directions:
5199 Brighton Ave. San Diego, CA 92107

From I-5: Take I-5 Fwy South to Sea World Drive turnoff; Turn right on Sea World and continue to Sunset Cliffs Blvd; Continue straight to Ocean Beach and turn right on West Point Loma Blvd; Follow West Point Loma Blvd 3 blocks to the beach.
description:
Welcome to another exciting season of beach volleyball in America's Finest City - San Diego, CA. We hope that your experience playing CBVA Beach Volleyball will be an enjoyable one.

Tournament site: George Stepanof Beach Volleyball Courts - 5199 Brighton Ave, San Diego, CA 92107

Tournament deadline: Deadline is 5:00 pm the day before a tournament. No refunds after 12:00 on the day before a tournament. NO EXCEPTIONS.

What to bring to the tournament: Plenty of water, sun protection, and lunch. A beach towel, chair and umbrella is a good idea. Local eateries are about a 5 minute walk from the courts.

On the day of the tournament: Check in is at 8:15 am. Competition begins at 9:00am. We will have pool play and then single elimination playoffs.

name: Main Beach
directions: Location and Parking: The courts are located between the Wharf and SC Boardwalk on Beach Drive, Santa Cruz. Cross street: Main Street.  There is street parking and several all day parking lots within walking distance of the courts. There are a variety of places to eat close to the courts and a small market/liquor store- all walking distance.
description:
WEDNESDAY JUNIOR EVENTS open for registration Tuesday, 4 weeks before at 6pm.

SATURDAY RATED EVENTS open for registration Friday, 4 weeks before at 6pm.

CLOSED=Not open for registrations yet.

Registration: All Santa Cruz events, both junior and adult, open four weeks and one day before the event date. This is to ensure all players have an equal opportunity to participate.

Check In and Start Time: 8:00am to 8:45am. Play starts promptly at 9:15 unless otherwise noted. If you are running late- please text or call me- 831-359-2721.

Format: Tournaments are pool play, single elimination playoffs unless otherwise noted.

Refund/Cancellation Policy: IMPORTANT There is a 72 hour cancellation requirement to receive a refund. This policy is specific to Santa Cruz, and is different from the standard CBVA policy. If canceling, please email both the director and the CBVA office (info@cbva.com).

If you have any questions about tournaments or beach volleyball in Santa Cruz, please contact me! Text, phone call or email all work well.

name: Dockweiler
directions:
From the 105 West freeway/Imperial Hwy:
Go South on Vista Del Mar about 1/4 mile to the 2nd traffic light and turn into the parking lot. The location is also the El Segundo Youth Center. You can google that in your phone GPS.


Parking lot will be on the right hand side; Park in pay lot and courts are just in front of it. 12501 Vista Del Mar
Playa del Rey, CA 90293

The location also has the El Segundo Beach Cafe which opens at 10am for breakfast and lunch. Great menu items! A menu will be at the tournament board for calling ahead for food to go!
description:
PARKING & FOOD
Dockweiler Parking lot has plenty of parking available. There is either a parking attendant or kiosk pay machines. Rates vary with time of year. Food, snacks and drinks are available at the Food Restaurant at the beach.

name: Wave Courts
directions:
15555 Jimmy Durante Blvd, Del Mar, Ca 92014
Next to the Del Mar Racetrack
description:
Aloha and welcome to another exciting season of beach volleyball in America's Finest City - San Diego, CA. We hope that your experience playing CBVA Beach Volleyball will be an enjoyable one.

TOURNAMENT SITE: Wave Volleyball Club Courts is a three court facility, with three state of the art courts, changing and shower rooms, and clean restrooms.

DEADLINE TO ENTRY & REFUNDS: Deadline is 5:00 pm the day before a tournament. No refunds after 12:00 pm on the day before the tournament. NO EXCEPTIONS.

ON THE DAY OF THE TOURNAMENT: Check in is at 8:15 am. At 9:00 we will review tournament rules and demonstrate some of the basic beach volleyball skills need to compete in the tournament. At 9:15 we will assign pools and courts. Competition begins at 9:30. Playoffs normally start at 1:00 and the tournament ends around 4:30. Wave VB Courts check in will 8:30, competition begins at 9:00.

WHAT TO BRING TO THE TOURNAMENT: Plenty of water, sun protection and lunch. A beach towel, chair and
